original: pha rol gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud spangs nas gzhan rnams la'o //
analyzed: pha rol gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud spangs nas gzhan rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf others‚Äù means of those other than one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: spyod yul min zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshon par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i @97a * //
analyzed: spyod yul min zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i phyir ro // mtshon par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i @97a * //
translated: ‚ÄúNot an object‚Äù means that it is not an object.üîΩ‚ÄúDifficult to show‚Äù means that it cannot be shown without the

original: gdams ngag med par mtshon par mi nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gdams ngag med par mtshon par mi nus pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: instruction of a guru.

original: dpe des zhes bya ba ni de dang mtshungs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe des zhes bya ba ni de dang mtshungs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that example‚Äù means that there is no other example like it.

original: rang gi blo la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: rang gi blo la zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la ltos nas /
translated: ‚ÄúIn one‚Äôs own mind‚Äù means that, in dependence on natural

original: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa rang la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa rang la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: purity, the consciousness of the yogin is said to ‚Äúabide in itself.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHaving abandoned that‚Äù means that, because it is not

original: de spangs nas rang gi bdag nyid mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de spangs nas rang gi bdag nyid mi dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: observed in itself, it is not an object of the mind.

original: rang rig pa zhes bshad pa yi //
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes bshad pa yi //
translated: It is explained as ‚Äúself-awareness.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'di nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'di nyid kyis so //
translated: This is the reason.

original: gzhon nu ma yi bde ba bzhin //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma yi bde ba bzhin //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the bliss of a virgin‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni skye gnas ma nyams pa gzhon nu ma'i bde ba ni skyes pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i bde ba rang gis rig par bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye gnas ma nyams pa gzhon nu ma'i bde ba ni skyes pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i bde ba rang gis rig par bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning: Just as the bliss of a young girl whose birth-place is not damaged is a bliss arisen from the condition of a man, and is to be known by herself,

original: ngag gi spyod yul ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and is not within the range of speech, so also is this.

original: de ltar rang rig gi tshig rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang rig gi tshig rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the words of self-awareness extensively,

original: mchog gi tshig brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mchog gi tshig brjod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to express the words of the supreme,

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says supreme, etc.

original: gsal bar nyams su myong zhes bya ba ni gsal bar snang bas na rig pa'o //
analyzed: gsal bar nyams su myong zhes bya ba ni gsal bar snang bas na rig pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúclearly experienced‚Äù is that it is awareness because it appears clearly.

original: de nyid mchog dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid mchog dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That itself is supreme, etc.

original: mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief teaching.

original: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni /
translated: The extensive explanation of that is

original: de spangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de spangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, abandoning that, etc.

original: rig pa gsum po spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa gsum po spangs pa'o //
translated: Abandoning the three awarenesses.

original: mchog dang zhes bya ba ni mchog ni rtog pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mchog dang zhes bya ba ni mchog ni rtog pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Supreme is the supreme, which is thought, etc.üîΩEverything is also thought,

original: thams cad kyang yin la rtog pa yang yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la rtog pa yang yin te /
translated: and

original: yod pa dang med pa dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa spros pa'i ngo bo'o ;
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa spros pa'i ngo bo'o ;
translated: Existence, non-existence, entity, and non-entity are the nature of conceptual elaboration.

original: / de rnams la sogs pa gang rnams la yod pa de ni rtog pa kun la sogs pa de rnams kyang yin la rtog pa yang yin te /
analyzed: / de rnams la sogs pa gang rnams la yod pa de ni rtog pa kun la sogs pa de rnams kyang yin la rtog pa yang yin te /
translated: Those that have such things as that are conceptual elaborations, and they are also concepts.

original: phra ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa can rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa can rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are conceptual elaborations that have the aspect of subtle conceptualization.

original: de rnams spangs pa'i bdag nyid gang la yod pa de rtog pa kun la sogs pa'i gsal ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams spangs pa'i bdag nyid gang la yod pa de rtog pa kun la sogs pa'i gsal ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That which has the nature of abandoning those is the nature of the clarity of all conceptual elaborations.

original: rigs pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam pa'i rang rig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam pa'i rang rig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is non-conceptual, free from reasoning and conceptualization, and has the meaning of reflexive awareness.

original: de ltar mchog gi tshig bstan par bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar mchog gi tshig bstan par bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the supreme words in that way,

original: da ni mchog gi tshig rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mchog gi tshig rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the extensive version of the supreme words,

original: de ni mchog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni mchog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat is supreme‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: de las rnam par mi rtog pa nyams su myong ba las mchog go //
analyzed: de las rnam par mi rtog pa nyams su myong ba las mchog go //
translated: Supreme means that it is superior to the experience of non-conceptuality.

original: bde ba che zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: bde ba che zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The great bliss is the nature of great bliss,

original: rtag tu lhan cig skyes pa gcig pu'i mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu lhan cig skyes pa gcig pu'i mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always co-emergent and is the ultimate of the one.üîΩThe three realities have the same characteristic,

original: de nyid gsum du mtshan nyid gcig / ces bya ba ni dga' ba gsum po mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid gsum du mtshan nyid gcig / ces bya ba ni dga' ba gsum po mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the three joys have the same characteristic.

original: lus ngag yid gsum @97b gyi de kho na nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum @97b gyi de kho na nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The three realities of body, speech, and mind.

original: de dang bral bas de brjod de //
analyzed: de dang bral bas de brjod de //
translated: The statement ‚Äúfree from that‚Äù is the expression of that.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dang zhes bya ba ni lus kyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa dang ngo bral ba ni spang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dang zhes bya ba ni lus kyi de kho na nyid la sogs pa dang ngo bral ba ni spang ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúfree from that‚Äù means free from the reality of the body, etc.

original: de brjod de zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de brjod de zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The expression of that is the self-knowing gnosis.

original: gnyis po thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: gnyis po thams cad rnam par spangs //
translated: All duality is completely abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su snang ba thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su snang ba thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All appearances of duality do not exist.

original: de ltar de ni mchog gi bstan pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar de ni mchog gi bstan pa bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the teaching of the supreme,

original: kun rtog gi stong pa'i tshig rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun rtog gi stong pa'i tshig rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to explain the extensive words of the emptiness of imagination,üîΩhe says:

original: dngos dang dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The phrase existence and nonexistence, and so on, refers to the following.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas bral ba'i blo'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas bral ba'i blo'o //
translated: The word mind refers to the mind that is free from conceptualization such as this.

original: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba lhag mas kha bskang nas 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba lhag mas kha bskang nas 'brel par bya'o //
translated: The phrase should cultivate is connected to the rest of the verse.

original: dngos dang dngos med ni yod pa dang med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med ni yod pa dang med pa'o //
translated: The words existence and nonexistence refer to being and nonbeing.

original: bde ba'i bdag nyid sdug bsngal gyi rtog pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba'i bdag nyid sdug bsngal gyi rtog pa ni /
translated: The phrase the conception of suffering in the nature of happiness refers to the following.

original: bde ba'i bdag nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: bde ba'i bdag nyid kyang yin la /
translated: The words the nature of happiness refer to the nature of happiness.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid kyang yin te /
translated: The words the nature of suffering refer to the nature of suffering.

original: bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal la dngos dang dngos med bde ba'i bdag nyid sdug bsngal lo //üîΩde nyid ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal la dngos dang dngos med bde ba'i bdag nyid sdug bsngal lo // de nyid ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The phrase the nature of suffering in the nature of happiness refers to the nature of suffering in the nature of happiness.üîΩThe words the conception of suffering refer to the conception of suffering.

original: dngos dang dngos med bde ba'i bdag nyid sdug bsngal can no //üîΩ'khor ba thar pa'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med bde ba'i bdag nyid sdug bsngal can no // 'khor ba thar pa'i bdag nyid can //
translated: The phrase the nature of suffering in the nature of happiness refers to the nature of suffering in the nature of happiness.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang grol ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcings pa dang grol ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The phrase the nature of cyclic existence and liberation refers to the nature of bondage and the nature of liberation.üîΩThe words the conception of suffering refer to the conception of suffering.

original: 'khor ba ni lha la sogs pa'i rnam pas phung po la sogs pa rnams yongs su ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni lha la sogs pa'i rnam pas phung po la sogs pa rnams yongs su ma shes pa'o //
translated: Samsara is the non-understanding of the aggregates, etc. in the form of gods, etc.

original: de las bzlog pas yongs su shes pa ni thar pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas yongs su shes pa ni thar pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the understanding of that.

original: de'i bdag nyid gang la yong pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid gang la yong pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has that as its nature is so-called.üîΩThe conduct of duality and non-duality is natural.

original: gnyis dang gnyis med rnam spyod rang bzhin dang // zhes bya ba ni gnyis ni gnyis su rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis med rnam spyod rang bzhin dang // zhes bya ba ni gnyis ni gnyis su rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis spyod pa ste /
translated: Duality is the conduct by the characteristic of the discrimination of duality.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: phung po lnga rnams la rang bzhin med par rtogs par bya ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la sogs pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams la rang bzhin med par rtogs par bya ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa lnga la sogs pa'i rnam pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: the meditation on the forms of the five Tathagatas, etc. for the sake of realizing the absence of intrinsic reality in the five aggregates.

original: gnyis med rnam spyod ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyis chos thams cad rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis med rnam spyod ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyis chos thams cad rtogs pa'o //
translated: The conduct of non-duality is the realization of all things by means of natural luminosity.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ni gnyi ga'i spyod pa nub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ni gnyi ga'i spyod pa nub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is free from intrinsic reality because the conduct of both has disappeared.

original: blo ni zhes bya ba ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: blo ni zhes bya ba ni shes rab ste /
translated: The mind is wisdom.

original: rnal 'byor pa dang 'brel pa bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dang 'brel pa bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
translated: One should meditate on the connection with the yogi.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / zhi ba'i rtog pa'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir / zhi ba'i rtog pa'i bdag nyid can //
translated: What is it like?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The nature of peaceful thought.

original: zhi ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: Peaceful is the pacification of all conceptual thoughts.

original: rtog pa ni ye shes so //
analyzed: rtog pa ni ye shes so //
translated: Thought is wisdom.

original: de'i bdag nyid can ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba @98a * //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba @98a * //
translated: The nature of that is the pacification of conceptual thoughts.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩThe one who is said to cut off the afflictions

original: gsungs pa'i nyon mongs gcod pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa'i rim pa gnyis bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i nyon mongs gcod pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa'i rim pa gnyis bsgoms pas nyon mongs pa gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the one who, by meditating on the two stages of existence, cuts off the afflictions.

original: 'gro ba gsum zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba gsum zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i yul la'o //
translated: The three realms are the objects of the three realms.

original: kun rtog dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rtog dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Free from conceptual thought means ultimately pure.

original: 'dis ni kun rtog gi rtog pa stong pa'i tshig bstan pa bshad nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni kun rtog gi rtog pa stong pa'i tshig bstan pa bshad nas /
translated: This explains the statement about the emptiness of conceptual thoughts.

original: de ltar don rnam pa bdun gyis thun mong ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don rnam pa bdun gyis thun mong ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus explained the extensive explanation by following the common tantra with the seven topics,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the extensive explanation by following the uncommon tantra,

original: de'i yan lag lhan cig skyes ba'i dus rgyas par bshad pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i yan lag lhan cig skyes ba'i dus rgyas par bshad pa bstan pa ni /
translated: the extensive explanation of the time of the connate is explained as its branch:

original: shes dang shes bya'i rnam rtog bral //
analyzed: shes dang shes bya'i rnam rtog bral //
translated: Free from the concepts of consciousness and object of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: rtogs bya dang rtogs byed kyi rnam rtog gi ngo bo rnam par spangs so //
analyzed: rtogs bya dang rtogs byed kyi rnam rtog gi ngo bo rnam par spangs so //
translated: The nature of the concepts of the object of realization and the realizer are totally abandoned.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Bliss is the characteristic of the connate.

original: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa nyid kyis bcos ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa nyid kyis bcos ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Nature is unfabricated because it arises from causes and conditions.

original: mthar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dga' ba gsum gyi mtha' nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dga' ba gsum gyi mtha' nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It becomes the ultimate because it abides as the ultimate of the three joys.

original: 'gro kun zhes bya ba ni de rnams la khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro kun zhes bya ba ni de rnams la khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAll beings‚Äù means that it pervades them.

original: zhi ba'i zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i dus na /
analyzed: zhi ba'i zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i dus na /
translated: ‚ÄúPeace‚Äù means that at the time of experience,

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ma lus pa dang 'dres shing tha mi dang pa'o ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ma lus pa dang 'dres shing tha mi dang pa'o ;
translated: it is mixed with all the qualities of a buddha and is not separate from them.

original: / mchog gi mchog rab ces bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba gzhan med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: / mchog gi mchog rab ces bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba gzhan med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSupreme of all‚Äù means that there is nothing else like it.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rtag tu de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rtag tu de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúReality‚Äù means that it always abides in its own nature.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid snyam du bsams nas so //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid snyam du bsams nas so //
translated: Thinking ‚ÄúThat is its nature,‚Äù

original: 'gro ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag po nyid kyis 'gro ba rnams la bde ba bskyed pa na bde ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag po nyid kyis 'gro ba rnams la bde ba bskyed pa na bde ba gsol ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe happiness of beings‚Äù means that when it generates happiness in beings by its very nature, it is the bestower of happiness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de dang / nye bar gnas pa tsam gyis te //üîΩskyed pa yid bzhin nor bu ltar //
analyzed: de dang / nye bar gnas pa tsam gyis te // skyed pa yid bzhin nor bu ltar //
translated: And by its mere presence,üîΩlike a wish-fulfilling gem,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa 'byung ba ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa 'byung ba ltar //
translated: it produces whatever is desired.

original: rtsig pa shing sogs brtan pa 'byung //
analyzed: rtsig pa shing sogs brtan pa 'byung //
translated: Like a firm wall, tree, and so on,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is the source of all qualities.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / rtsod pa'i dus kyi mtha' dang bral //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir / rtsod pa'i dus kyi mtha' dang bral //
translated: What is it like?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Free from the end of the age of conflict.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'bum phrag lnga'i lo'i tshad kyi snyigs ma lngas gang ba'i rtsod pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: 'bum phrag lnga'i lo'i tshad kyi snyigs ma lngas gang ba'i rtsod pa'i dus na ste /
translated: In the age of conflict, filled with the five degenerations, the measure of which is five hundred thousand years,

original: rtsod pa'i dus las log pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i dus las log pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: it is the nature of the opposite of the age of conflict.

original: de mngon du byed pas dus kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon du byed pas dus kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is actualized, there is no appearance of time.üîΩOr, it is said:

original: yang na / dus ni rtsod pa'i dus zhes bshad //
analyzed: yang na / dus ni rtsod pa'i dus zhes bshad //
translated: Time is explained as the age of conflict.

original: ces bya ba gzhung kha cig las @98b te ;
analyzed: ces bya ba gzhung kha cig las @98b te ;
translated: In some texts,

original: de'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: de'i phyogs la ni /
translated: in that position,

original: rang rig pa'i ye shes nyid kyis rtsod pa'i dus te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i ye shes nyid kyis rtsod pa'i dus te /
translated: the age of conflict is the very self-awareness of pristine consciousness.üîΩIn that time,

original: dus der phyi rol gyi phyag rgya'i rim pas /
analyzed: dus der phyi rol gyi phyag rgya'i rim pas /
translated: since it is illustrated by the stage of the external consort,

original: de mtshon pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de mtshon pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: it is the very illustration of that.

original: bzhi ba'i mtshan nyid skad cig can //üîΩzhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: bzhi ba'i mtshan nyid skad cig can // zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The fourth has the characteristic of a moment.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam pa nye bar dmigs bzhin pa'o ;
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam pa nye bar dmigs bzhin pa'o ;
translated: The fourth stage of joy and so on is the aspect of the connate [joy] that is observed.

original: / rtog med ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rtog med ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-conceptual‚Äù means that the counteragent has destroyed the opposing side.

original: 'khrul 'khor spong la mkhas zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor spong la mkhas zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ni srid pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSkilled in abandoning the machine‚Äù means that the machine is the world, which is existence.

original: de nyid ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: That itself is the error,

original: rnam par 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'khor ba ste /
translated: the wandering,

original: phyin ci log gi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir srid pa'i 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i phyir srid pa'i 'khrul pa'o //
translated: the existence-error, because it is produced by the power of error.

original: de bzlog pa ni rim pa gnyis bsgoms pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de bzlog pa ni rim pa gnyis bsgoms pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las rgyal ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of that is the victory over the counteragent through the cultivation of the two stages.

original: de la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni /
translated: Skill in that is

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dbang gis 'khrul 'khor bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dbang gis 'khrul 'khor bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: the abandonment of the machine through the power of the innate.

original: gzhan yang ro gcig pa bde ba chen pos myos zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa chen po'i ro ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang ro gcig pa bde ba chen pos myos zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa chen po'i ro ni /
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúintoxicated with the great bliss of one taste‚Äù means that the taste of the great sameness is

original: tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can gyis so //
translated: the nature of the different conceptualizations.

original: myos pa ni tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo'i bde ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: myos pa ni tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo'i bde ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: Intoxication is the special bliss that is the nature of the absence of different conceptualizations.

original: des mnyam pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: des mnyam pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: The gnosis that is equalized by that isüîΩthe great bliss of one taste.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rnam par rtog pa log pa'i ngo bo ni de'i mtshan nyid can de'i rang bzhin gyis dus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rnam par rtog pa log pa'i ngo bo ni de'i mtshan nyid can de'i rang bzhin gyis dus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The essence of the cessation of the conceptualization of the animate and inanimate is its characteristic, which is the meaning of ‚Äútime‚Äù by nature.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of inconceivable time.

original: de ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i dus rgyas par bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i dus rgyas par bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the time of innate joy in detail,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa'i tshig rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa spangs pa'i tshig rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain in detail the words ‚Äúabandoning the apprehended and the apprehender,‚Äù

original: gzung ba rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzung ba rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe apprehended,‚Äù and so on.

original: yul cang yi shes pas snang bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul cang yi shes pas snang bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the appearance of objects through consciousness.

original: yul rnams zhes bya ba ni spyod yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yul rnams zhes bya ba ni spyod yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Objects‚Äù means those that have become the sphere of experience.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las zhes bya ba ni lnga'am drug las so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las zhes bya ba ni lnga'am drug las so //
translated: ‚Äú From forms and so on‚Äù means from five or six.

original: kun nas zhes bya ba ni mdog dang dbyibs la sogs pa ji ltar srid pa kun nas so //
analyzed: kun nas zhes bya ba ni mdog dang dbyibs la sogs pa ji ltar srid pa kun nas so //
translated: ‚Äú Completely‚Äù means in every way, such as color, shape, and so on.

original: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gzung bya'i yul 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gzung bya'i yul 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The grasping is because of the grasping of the object to be grasped.

original: dbang po zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The faculties are the eye, etc.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis te /
translated: Naturally means by its very nature.

original: de la mngon du phyogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon du phyogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the directness of that.

original: de dang bral zhing mchog tu phra //
analyzed: de dang bral zhing mchog tu phra //
translated: Free from that, supreme subtlety

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dag gis rnam par dben pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dag gis rnam par dben pa ste /
translated: means free from the faculties and objects, which have the nature of the grasped and grasper.

original: lhan cig skyes pa thob pa'i dus su de lta bu'i snang ba thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog @99a * //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa thob pa'i dus su de lta bu'i snang ba thob pa'i phyir ro // mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog @99a * //
translated: Because at the time of attaining the connate [joy], one attains such an appearance.

original: gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gi ngo bo'o //
translated: Supreme means the nature of the supreme.

original: phra zhes bya ba ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams kyis rig par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phra zhes bya ba ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams kyis rig par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Subtle means that which is to be known by the subtle yogas.

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom means the nature of experience.

original: bde ba kun gyi bdag ces pa ni bla na med pa'i bde ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba kun gyi bdag ces pa ni bla na med pa'i bde ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The line ‚Äúthe self of all happiness‚Äù refers to the nature of unsurpassed happiness.

original: 'khrul pa dang mchog ma yin pa dang mngon du ma gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang mchog ma yin pa dang mngon du ma gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no error, no inferiority, and no non-manifestation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sdug bsngal kun las rnam par grol //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las rnam par grol // zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is completely liberated from all suffering.

original: tha dad pa'i snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i snang ba med pa'i phyir ro // gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: Because there is no appearance of difference.

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The line ‚Äúfree from apprehended object and apprehending subject‚Äù is as above.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'i tshig bstan nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir //üîΩbde ba sems ni zhi ba nyid //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'i tshig bstan nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir // bde ba sems ni zhi ba nyid //
translated: Having thus explained the words ‚Äúfree from apprehended object and apprehending subject,‚Äù in order to express the words ‚Äúliberated from happiness and suffering,‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind of happiness is peace itself.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the pacification of conceptuality.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshig bshad pa'i phyir /üîΩsdug bsngal 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid des //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshig bshad pa'i phyir / sdug bsngal 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid des //
translated: In order to explain the word ‚Äúsuffering,‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe characteristic of samsara is suffering.‚Äù

original: phung po lnga dang khams dang skye mched kyi snang ba'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang khams dang skye mched kyi snang ba'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: The nature of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases is the appearance of samsara.

original: 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi phung po can zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi phung po can zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúthe mass of suffering of samsara.‚Äù

original: de las rnam par grol zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de las rnam par grol zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLiberated from that‚Äù means the essence of the pacification of conceptualization.

original: 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal dag las rnam par grol ba ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sdug bsngal dag las rnam par grol ba ni bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLiberated from the suffering that is characterized by samsara‚Äù means separation.

original: 'jigs pa med ces bya ba ni phyogs gcig gis 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med ces bya ba ni phyogs gcig gis 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFearless‚Äù means that there is no fear that is characterized by the arising of a single aspect.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: med pa po ni ngan 'gror 'gro //
analyzed: med pa po ni ngan 'gror 'gro //
translated: The nihilist goes to a bad rebirth.

original: yod pa po ni bzang por 'gro //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod pa po ni bzang por 'gro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The essentialist goes to a good rebirth.

original: de nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement of that is:

original: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nonabiding nirvana.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi sgo nas 'khor ba la gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi sgo nas 'khor ba la gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of abiding in samsara through the door of wisdom,

original: snying rje sgo nas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje sgo nas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, from the point of view of compassion, the qualities of nirvana are not perceived.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rnam pas so //üîΩji skad du /üîΩshes pas srid la mi gnas dang // snying rjes zhi la mi gnas shing //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rnam pas so // ji skad du / shes pas srid la mi gnas dang // snying rjes zhi la mi gnas shing //
translated: Also, from the point of view of compassion, one does not perceive the virtues of nirvana.üîΩ[The bodhisattva] is connected with the experience of the nature of great intuition which is emptiness, by the cultivation of the pride of the five [Buddhas],

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: or by the cultivation of the stages of mantra, etc.

original: don de nyid ni rang nyid kyis kyang gsungs te ;
analyzed: don de nyid ni rang nyid kyis kyang gsungs te ;
translated: This very meaning is stated by the BhagavƒÅn himself:

original: stong nyid ye shes chen po'i bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩlnga'i nga rgyal bsgoms pas sam /üîΩsngags la sogs pa'i rim pa bsgoms pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyis ye shes chen po'i bdag nyid can nyams su myong bar 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: stong nyid ye shes chen po'i bdag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste / lnga'i nga rgyal bsgoms pas sam / sngags la sogs pa'i rim pa bsgoms pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyis ye shes chen po'i bdag nyid can nyams su myong bar 'brel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of great intuition which is emptiness,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'khor @99b ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba drug gi dbye ba tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor @99b ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba drug gi dbye ba tha dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe world‚Äù is the differentiation of the six migrations.

original: sdug bsngal mi 'byung zhing zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don byed kyang de'i log par rtog pa rnams kyi ngal ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩthugs rjes dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi 'byung zhing zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don byed kyang de'i log par rtog pa rnams kyi ngal ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro // thugs rjes dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout suffering‚Äù means that even when they work for the welfare of sentient beings, they are not exhausted by the errors of those beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba mtha' yas par goms par byas pas snying rje chen bos gzhan dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba mtha' yas par goms par byas pas snying rje chen bos gzhan dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are controlled by compassion‚Äù means that they are controlled by others through their great compassion, because they have cultivated it over limitless lives.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam rtog nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa bde ba mi bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam rtog nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pa bde ba mi bskyed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äù means that they do not generate the bliss that is the aspect of the pacification of conceptuality.

original: zhi ba'i ro mi myang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i ro mi myang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not experience the taste of peace.

original: de ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba'i tshig bstan pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba'i tshig bstan pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the words that teach liberation from happiness and suffering in that way,

original: zhib dang gnyis med kyi tshig rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir //üîΩzhi ba nyan thos ye shes nyid //
analyzed: zhib dang gnyis med kyi tshig rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir // zhi ba nyan thos ye shes nyid //
translated: in order to explain in detail the words that teach the absence of the two extremes,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe wisdom of the peace of the hearers . . .‚Äù

original: phung po nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: phung po nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The nirvana without remainder, which is characterized by the pacification of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i rnam par rtog pa dang nyon mongs pa dag bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i rnam par rtog pa dang nyon mongs pa dag bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nirvana without remainder, which has the characteristic of the complete pacification of the aggregates, because it is free from the conceptualization of the aggregates and from the afflictions.

original: gnyis med tshogs dang bse ru'o //
analyzed: gnyis med tshogs dang bse ru'o //
translated: The two without duality are the assembly and the rhinoceros.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas bse ru ltar spyod pa dang tshogs na spyod pa gzung ba'i don dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas bse ru ltar spyod pa dang tshogs na spyod pa gzung ba'i don dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddha is free from the object of grasping, because he practices alone and in an assembly.

original: gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: Theirs is the happiness of the nondiscursive.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Theirs refers to the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: bde ba dang rtog byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni de rab tu grags pa'i thabs las byung ba'i dbye ba po de spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang rtog byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni de rab tu grags pa'i thabs las byung ba'i dbye ba po de spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi phyir ro //
translated: The happiness of the nondiscursive is the characteristic of the abandonment of that which is well known as the means of discursiveness.

original: de dang bral ba'i bde ba chen po zhes bya ba ni 'di ni bde ba chen po'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i bde ba chen po zhes bya ba ni 'di ni bde ba chen po'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The great bliss free from that is the nature of great bliss.

original: de bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that, he says:

original: 'di dga' ba gnyis kyi dus zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di dga' ba gnyis kyi dus zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is called the time of the two joys.

original: nyan thos ye shes zhes bya ba ni zag pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: nyan thos ye shes zhes bya ba ni zag pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvaka‚Äôs ‚Äúwisdom‚Äù is due to the meaning of outflows.

original: dga' ba gnyis kyi dus ni de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro//
analyzed: dga' ba gnyis kyi dus ni de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro//
translated: The time of the two joys is due to its nature.

original: gang zhig gnas skabs de la mgo bo'i 'khor lo nas lus thams cad kyi mthar thug par zag pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gnas skabs de la mgo bo'i 'khor lo nas lus thams cad kyi mthar thug par zag pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: That which generates outflows from the head cakra to the end of the entire body is the time of the two joys.

original: de mthar zhes bya ba ni dga' ba gnyis kyi mthar ro //
analyzed: de mthar zhes bya ba ni dga' ba gnyis kyi mthar ro //
translated: ‚Äú At the end of that‚Äù is at the end of the two joys.

original: dga' bral ba zhes bya ba ni chags bral ngo bo'o //üîΩrang rgyal mya ngan 'das pa dang // zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: dga' bral ba zhes bya ba ni chags bral ngo bo'o // rang rgyal mya ngan 'das pa dang // zhes bya bas ni /
translated: ‚Äú Free of joy‚Äù is the nature of freedom from attachment.

original: rang rgyal mya ngan las 'das pa //
analyzed: rang rgyal mya ngan las 'das pa //
translated: The pratyekabuddha‚Äôs nirvƒÅ·πáa

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meansüîΩthe pratyekabuddha‚Äôs nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de'i phyogs gcig la chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig la chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being free from attachment to one part of that.

original: rang rgyal gyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni nye bar zhi ba 'jig pa'i snyam du dgongs nas su /
analyzed: rang rgyal gyi rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni nye bar zhi ba 'jig pa'i snyam du dgongs nas su /
translated: Thinking that the nirvƒÅ·πáa of the nature of the pratyekabuddha is the peace of destruction,

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i zhi ba ni nyan thos kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i zhi ba ni nyan thos kyi ye shes so //
translated: Such peace is the wisdom of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye @100a * //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye @100a * //

translated: The good aeon is the abundance of the good aeon, and the seeds of the sense-fields are present.

original: thams cad bdag nyid du bzhugs zhes bya ba ni lus @101b thams cad la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid du bzhugs zhes bya ba ni lus @101b thams cad la gnas pa'o //
translated: All of them reside in the self means that they are located in the entire body.

original: de ltar rten gyi ngo bo rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba brjod pas so //
analyzed: de ltar rten gyi ngo bo rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba brjod pas so //
translated: Thus, by describing the nature of the support, the union of the vajra and lotus is expressed.

original: rten pa'i ngo bo bshad pa'i phyir spyod pa brjod pa ni de'i 'dab ma la skyes bzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rten pa'i ngo bo bshad pa'i phyir spyod pa brjod pa ni de'i 'dab ma la skyes bzhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain the nature of the supported, the description of the conduct is stated: born on its petals.

original: de'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i 'dab ma rnams la rnam shas brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i 'dab ma rnams la rnam shas brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: On the petals of that Dharma wheel, the eight consciousnesses occur.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ; nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes ba'i rang bzhin can gyis brgyad do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ; nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes ba'i rang bzhin can gyis brgyad do //
translated: The eight are the nature of the eye consciousness, etc., the afflicted consciousness, and the store consciousness.

original: kun rdzob bo zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa la snang bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob bo zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa la snang bzhin pa'o //
translated: The conventional is what appears to the world.

original: 'byung zhes bya ba ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung zhes bya ba ni yod pa'o //
translated: To exist is to be.

original: 'gro ba gsum du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'gro ba gsum du zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The three realms are characterized by the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: rnam par spyod ces bya ba ni yul la 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rnam par spyod ces bya ba ni yul la 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: To experience is to grasp objects.

original: ci zhig byas nas she na /üîΩde'i phyir / mig la sogs pa yang dag rten //
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na / de'i phyir / mig la sogs pa yang dag rten //
translated: What is done?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The eye, etc., are the correct supports.

original: dbang po drug po'o //
analyzed: dbang po drug po'o //
translated: The six sense faculties.

original: de dag 'joms pa rlung rdo rje //
analyzed: de dag 'joms pa rlung rdo rje //
translated: Those are the winds that destroy the vajra.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag ni snying ga'i padmar gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag ni snying ga'i padmar gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo'o ;
translated: Those are the nature of the consciousnesses that abide in the heart lotus.

original: /'joms zhes bya ba ni mi snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: /'joms zhes bya ba ni mi snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: To destroy is to make them invisible.

original: rlung rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i bzhon par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rlung rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i bzhon par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The ‚Äúvajra wind‚Äù is the mount of consciousness.

original: las kyi rlung gi stobs kyis skyes pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi rlung gi stobs kyis skyes pa ste /
translated: Or, it is generated by the power of the karma wind.

original: ye shes kyi me skyes nas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi me skyes nas zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe fire of pristine consciousness arises‚Äù is the remainder.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bgegs mthar byed pa zhes pa ni brjod ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bgegs mthar byed pa zhes pa ni brjod ces gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚ÄúVighnƒÅntaka is expressed.‚Äù

original: bgegs rnams ni rnam par g-yengs bar byed pa'i rnam par shes ba'i tshogs brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: bgegs rnams ni rnam par g-yengs bar byed pa'i rnam par shes ba'i tshogs brgyad rnams so //
translated: The ‚Äúobstructions‚Äù are the eight collections of consciousness that cause distraction.

original: mthar byed pa ni zlog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mthar byed pa ni zlog par byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDestroyer‚Äù means to turn away.

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i ngo bo khro bo'i gzugs dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i ngo bo khro bo'i gzugs dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is similar to the form of the wrathful one, the essence of Am·πõtaku·πá·∏çali.

original: rnam shes rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni gsungs ma thag pa'i rnam shes gang de'o //
analyzed: rnam shes rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni gsungs ma thag pa'i rnam shes gang de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso the consciousnesses‚Äù are those consciousnesses that were just mentioned.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i 'dab ma rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i 'dab ma rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to the petals of the dharmacakra.

original: 'jig rten skyong ba rnams su brjod //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba rnams su brjod //
translated: They are called the ‚Äúguardians of the world.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are Indra and so on.

original: yang na 'jig rten ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa skyong bar byed pas yongs su gcod par byed pas na 'jig rten skyong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa skyong bar byed pas yongs su gcod par byed pas na 'jig rten skyong ba'o //
translated: Or else, the world is protected by the guardians of the world, because they protect the world from the seizure of form, etc.

original: 'jig rten gsum du kun nas khyab //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du kun nas khyab //
translated: It is pervaded in the three worlds

original: ces bya ba ni mtho ris dang / sa stong dang / sa 'og gi mtshan nyid can gyi rang gi lus sam 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams kyi bde bas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mtho ris dang / sa stong dang / sa 'og gi mtshan nyid can gyi rang gi lus sam 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams kyi bde bas so //
translated: by the bliss of the realm of desire, etc., which is characterized by the heavens, the earth, and the underworld.

original: kun nas khyab pa ni rten nas so //
analyzed: kun nas khyab pa ni rten nas so //
translated: It is pervaded by the support.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni bzhugs pa'o //üîΩlha rnams zhes bya ba ni lha rnams gang la 'gro ba yod pa de ni lha rnams 'gro @102a * //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni bzhugs pa'o // lha rnams zhes bya ba ni lha rnams gang la 'gro ba yod pa de ni lha rnams 'gro @102a * //
translated: The abode is the dwelling place.

original: ba ste sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ba ste sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The gods are those who go to the gods, because they have the nature of Bodhisattvas such as Kshitigarbha, etc.

original: skyong ba yang ni thams cad kyis //
analyzed: skyong ba yang ni thams cad kyis //
translated: And it is protected by all

original: zhes bya ba ni thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyis so //
translated: means, in every way.

original: yul la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten skyong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten skyong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that the result of the world-protector, which has the characteristic of apprehending the object such as form, etc., is the meaning of the world-protector.üîΩThere,

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: means the eighth consciousness.üîΩThe union of wind

original: rlung gi yang dag sbyor zhes bya ba ni rlung dang 'brel ba'i snang bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gi yang dag sbyor zhes bya ba ni rlung dang 'brel ba'i snang bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: means that it is the nature of illumination, because it is connected with wind.

original: rdo rje padma zhes byar brjod //
analyzed: rdo rje padma zhes byar brjod //
translated: It is called the vajra and lotus.

original: ces bya ba ni de ma thag par bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de ma thag par bshad pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: means that it is just as explained immediately above.

original: /'dis ni rten gyi ngo bo de'i bshad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: /'dis ni rten gyi ngo bo de'i bshad pa gsungs so //
translated: This explains the nature of the support.

original: da ni zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo de'i bshad pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo de'i bshad pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now, the explanation of the nature of union is stated:

original: rdo rje snying rjer shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje snying rjer shes par bya ba ste /
translated: The vajra is to be known as compassion.

original: rdo rje bzhin du sems can dang chos dang dmigs pa med pa'i dbye bas dus nam gyi tshe sems can gyi don byed pa las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rdo rje bzhin du sems can dang chos dang dmigs pa med pa'i dbye bas dus nam gyi tshe sems can gyi don byed pa las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Like a vajra, because of the division into sentient beings, phenomena, and the absence of an objective referent, one never turns away from the time when one acts for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: / padma yang ni stong pa nyid //
analyzed: / padma yang ni stong pa nyid //
translated: A lotus is emptiness.

original: ces bya ba ni padma ltar nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pas ma gos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni padma ltar nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pas ma gos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-defilement by afflictions and secondary afflictions, like a lotus.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni snying rje dang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni snying rje dang stong pa nyid do //
translated: Those means compassion and emptiness.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Union means the accomplishment of non-difference.

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog gi ngo bo'o //
translated: Supreme means the nature of the supreme.

original: shes zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor bar shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor bar shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Knowledge means the knowledge of the union of the vajra and lotus. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo de'i bshad pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo de'i bshad pa brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having described the nature of union,

original: rjes su chags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis de'i bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis de'i bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach its nature of passion,

original: rdo rje nyi ma zhes ni gsungs //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma zhes ni gsungs //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is said to be the vajra sun.

original: nyi ma'i ngo bo thabs kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i ngo bo thabs kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: The nature of the sun is the method vajra.

original: khyad par gyi sgo nas gtan tshigs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par gyi sgo nas gtan tshigs bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason is taught from the point of view of the distinction:

original: 'od zer tshogs kyi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: 'od zer tshogs kyi bdag nyid can //
translated: The nature of the collection of light rays

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: is the lotus.

original: 'od zer kha dog lnga pa spro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od zer kha dog lnga pa spro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of emitting the five-colored light rays.üîΩOf those,

original: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'od zer de rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'od zer de rnams kyi'o //
translated: means of those light rays.üîΩThe division

original: dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu sad pa'o //üîΩgang zhes bya ba ni padma'o //
analyzed: dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu sad pa'o // gang zhes bya ba ni padma'o //
translated: is the arousal.üîΩThat whichüîΩis the lotus.

original: de ni padma zhes bya ba ni padma'o //
analyzed: de ni padma zhes bya ba ni padma'o //
translated: That is the lotus.üîΩIs said

original: brjod ces bya ba ni bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni bshad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: means is explained.üîΩThat is the yoga

original: de ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma dag gi'o //
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dang padma dag gi'o //
translated: of the vajra and lotus.üîΩThe union

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: has the nature of a connection.üîΩSupreme

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog ste ;
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog ste ;
translated: is the best.

original: so so'i skye bo yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo yang dag par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of the union of the individual.

original: rdo rje padma mnyam sbyor shes //
analyzed: rdo rje padma mnyam sbyor shes //
translated: Knowing the union of the vajra and lotus,üîΩthe supreme is attained.

original: zhes bya ba ni @102b rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba shes par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni @102b rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba shes par bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the knowledge of the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: de ltar don rnam pa bzhis rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar don rnam pa bzhis rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba bshad nas /
translated: Thus, following the Great Yoga Tantra, the union of the vajra and lotus is explained in four topics.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas rdo rje dang padma mnyam par sbyor ba bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, following the Yoga Tantra, the union of the vajra and lotus is explained.

original: de'i yan lag rten dang rten can gyi ngo bo nyid kyis de bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yan lag rten dang rten can gyi ngo bo nyid kyis de bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of explaining that by means of the nature of the support and the supported,üîΩit is said:

original: gsungs pa / byang chub sems ni rdo rjer 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / byang chub sems ni rdo rjer 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The bodhicitta becomes the vajra.

original: kun rdzob kyi rnam pa'i ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rnam pa'i ste /
translated: The bodhicitta is the nature of the relative.

original: rdo rje'i lam nas de 'jug pa'i phyir dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lam nas de 'jug pa'i phyir dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it enters the path of the vajra and because it is the nature of all the transcendent lords.

original: bde chen 'khor lo padma'o //
analyzed: bde chen 'khor lo padma'o //
translated: The lotus is the wheel of great bliss.

original: zhes bya ba ni mgo bor gnas pa'i bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo padma'i dbyibs dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mgo bor gnas pa'i bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo padma'i dbyibs dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great bliss wheel is located at the head, because it is like the shape of a lotus.

original: de la zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid can gyi padma la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i mtshan nyid can gyi padma la'o //
translated: There means in the lotus that has the characteristic of the great bliss wheel.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi rnam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi rnam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is of the aspect of the relative.

original: sbyor ba gang zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa gang zhig ngo bo nyid dang rlung gzung ba'i stobs kyis sam gyen du rgyu ba'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: sbyor ba gang zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa gang zhig ngo bo nyid dang rlung gzung ba'i stobs kyis sam gyen du rgyu ba'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The union is the connection that has the characteristic of the stage of the upward movement by the power of holding the intrinsic wind.

original: rmad du byung zhes bya ba ni phyir ma spros pas rgas pa dang 'chi ba med pa bsgrub pa nyid kyis ngo mtshar bskyed pa po'o //
analyzed: rmad du byung zhes bya ba ni phyir ma spros pas rgas pa dang 'chi ba med pa bsgrub pa nyid kyis ngo mtshar bskyed pa po'o //
translated: Marvelous means that it generates wonder by accomplishing immortality and agelessness through not emitting externally.

original: de ltar rten dang brten pa can gyi ngo bo bshad pa bstan nas bla ma dang slob ma'i ngo bo nyid kyi bshad pa ni bla ma'i gsung ni zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: de ltar rten dang brten pa can gyi ngo bo bshad pa bstan nas bla ma dang slob ma'i ngo bo nyid kyi bshad pa ni bla ma'i gsung ni zhes bya ba gsungs te ;
translated: Having thus taught the nature of the support and the supported, the explanation of the nature of the guru and the disciple is stated in the guru's speech and so on.

original: rgyud du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bla ma mchog gi ngag gis sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa rim pa gnyis ston par byed pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rgyud du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bla ma mchog gi ngag gis sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa rim pa gnyis ston par byed pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words that reveal the two stages, which are the cause for attaining Buddhahood, are spoken by the supreme guru who possesses the characteristics taught in the tantras.

original: de ni rdo rje brjod ces bya ba brjod de /
analyzed: de ni rdo rje brjod ces bya ba brjod de /
translated: That is called the vajra utterance,

original: 'og bar mi bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'joms par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og bar mi bya ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'joms par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it should not be done below or in between, and because it conquers all conceptual thoughts.

original: slob ma zhes pa ni /
analyzed: slob ma zhes pa ni /
translated: The disciple is

original: de bzhin du rgyud du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
translated: one who has received empowerment, possessing the characteristics taught in the tantras in the same way.

original: snod ces bya ba ni snod du gyur pa'i rna ba'i dbang bo ste /
analyzed: snod ces bya ba ni snod du gyur pa'i rna ba'i dbang bo ste /
translated: The vessel is the ear faculty that is a suitable vessel,

original: gang gis bla ma'i ngag de nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis bla ma'i ngag de nyid thob pa'o //
translated: by which one hears the guru's speech.

original: padma de'i zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i gsung thos pas slob ma'i snying gi padma kha 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: padma de'i zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i gsung thos pas slob ma'i snying gi padma kha 'byed pa'o //
translated: The lotus is the lotus of the disciple's heart, which opens by hearing the guru's speech.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i gsung ngo //
translated: That refers to the guru's speech.

original: gnas de la zhes bya ba ni slob ma'i rna ba'i dbang po la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas de la zhes bya ba ni slob ma'i rna ba'i dbang po la gnas pa'o //
translated: In that place means in the place of the disciple's ear faculty.

original: de'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni de'i 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid can la'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni de'i 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid can la'o //
translated: Its application means in its connection, which is characterized by the master's speech.

original: mchog rmad 'byung zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i gsung gi stobs kyis slob mas mchog tu ngo mtshar pa'i ngo bo phyag rgya chen po thob pas so //üîΩgsal zhes @103a * //
analyzed: mchog rmad 'byung zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i gsung gi stobs kyis slob mas mchog tu ngo mtshar pa'i ngo bo phyag rgya chen po thob pas so // gsal zhes @103a * //
translated: Supreme and marvelous means that the disciple attains the supreme, wondrous nature of the great seal through the power of the master's speech.

original: bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar bla ma dang slob ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis de'i bshad pa bstan nas /

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis de'i bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir zhi gnas padma zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: rim pa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par ro //

original: de las lhag mthong rdo rje la //
analyzed: de las lhag mthong rdo rje la //
translated: From that, the vajra of insight

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan de nyid la spyod pa ste //

original: zung du 'jug pas rgyu ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pas rgyu ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de yang de la ma myangs ba nyid kyis snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de la ma myangs ba nyid kyis snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: And that is not experienced by him.üîΩThat very means serenity and insight.

original: de nyid zhes bya ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag go / de gnyis gcig gyur rnal 'byor ni //üîΩzhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid zhes bya ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag go / de gnyis gcig gyur rnal 'byor ni // zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis rgyu ba'o //

original: sgom pa yis ni de nyid mthong //
analyzed: sgom pa yis ni de nyid mthong //
translated: By cultivation one sees that very reality.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgom pa ni de ma thag par gsungs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi bdag nyid can gyis de nyid la lus dang ngag dang yid dang ye shes rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mthong ba ni thob pa zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgom pa ni de ma thag par gsungs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi bdag nyid can gyis de nyid la lus dang ngag dang yid dang ye shes rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mthong ba ni thob pa zhes bya ba'i don
translated: Cultivation is the very thing that was just mentioned, which has the nature of serenity and insight. By that, one attains the seeing of that very reality, which has the characteristic of the purification of body, speech, mind, and intuition.

original: to // de ltar bsam gtan gyi ngo bo bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: to // de ltar bsam gtan gyi ngo bo bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the nature of meditative concentration,

analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i bla ma dang / slob ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis bshad pa'i don du //

original: rnal 'byor ma zhal padmar gnas //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma zhal padmar gnas //
translated: The yoginƒ´ resides in the lotus of the face.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni gnas la sogs pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni gnas la sogs pa las skyes pa'o //

analyzed: zhal gyi padma ni gdong gi padma la'o ;
